title: Add in-app publishing guidance and shareable public URL (ICP-only)

requirements.text: Add a small in-app “Publishing / Share” section that clearly explains the app is published as a web app on the Internet Computer (not Google hosting), and provides the current public site URL (based on window.location.origin) with a one-click copy-to-clipboard action.
acceptanceCriteria: A user can find a “Publishing / Share” section from the main UI (e.g., footer link, header menu item, or a simple settings/about page).
The section contains English text stating that publishing/deployment is to the Internet Computer and that Google hosting is not supported in this project.
The section displays the current public URL (window.location.origin) and includes a “Copy link” button.
Clicking “Copy link” copies the URL to the clipboard and shows a success toast (or equivalent non-intrusive confirmation).

requirements.text: Ensure any user-facing text added for publishing uses clear English phrasing and avoids implying Google Cloud / Google Play deployment is available.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: No new UI copy suggests the app can be deployed to Google Cloud / Google Play.
All newly added user-facing strings are in English.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components must be composed, not edited).
Do not modify immutable frontend hook files (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend remains a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; no multi-service architecture.
Do not implement Google hosting / Google Cloud deployment (unsupported by platform constraints).
nonGoals: Building or deploying to Google Cloud, Firebase Hosting, Google Play Store, or any non-ICP hosting target
Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity)
Adding CI/CD pipelines or external deployment automation
